meanings.definition: The actions or conduct of a villain.
meanings.sent1: The villainy of the character in the story was evident from his sneaky actions.
meanings.sent2: The town was plagued by the villainy of the notorious thief.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the exaggerated villainy of the cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the forest whispered tales of villainy to the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The smell of deceit and villainy hung heavy in the air.

meanings.sent1: The sheriff vowed to put an end to the villainy that had been terrorizing the town.
meanings.sent2: The villainy of the gang members was finally brought to justice.
meanings.sent3: The villainy of the mischievous raccoon stealing apples amused the farmer.
meanings.sent4: The villainy of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night seemed to cloak the villainy lurking in the shadows.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a villain.
meanings.sent1: The actor's portrayal of villainy on stage was both convincing and chilling.
meanings.sent2: The novel delved into the depths of human villainy and redemption.
meanings.sent3: The costume party was filled with playful villainy as guests dressed up as famous bad guys.
meanings.sent4: The villainy of the situation was clear, but the hero remained undeterred.
meanings.sent5: The villainy in his eyes sent a shiver down her spine.
